verses.text: 要歌頌和倚靠 神的權能義人哪！你們要靠著耶和華歡呼；正直人讚美主是合宜的。
你們要彈琴稱謝耶和華，用十弦瑟歌頌他。

words.note: A verb-object compound.
A specific ancient stringed instrument.

verses.text: 你們要向他唱新歌，在歡呼聲中巧妙地彈奏。

words.note: Postposition indicating 'within' or 'among'.

verses.text: 因為耶和華的話是正直的，他的一切作為都是誠實的。
耶和華喜愛公義和公正，全地充滿耶和華的慈愛。
諸天藉著耶和華的話而造，天上的萬象藉著他口中的氣而成。

words.note: Lit. 'various heavens'.
Can mean air, breath, spirit, vital energy. Here, likely divine breath.

verses.text: 他把海水聚集成壘（「成壘」或譯：「在皮袋裡」），把深海安放在庫房中。
願全地都敬畏耶和華，願世上的居民都懼怕他。
因為他說有，就有；命立，就立。
耶和華破壞列國的謀略，使萬民的計劃挫敗。
耶和華的謀略永遠立定，他心中的計劃萬代長存。

words.note: Lit. 'myriad generations'

verses.text: 以耶和華為 神的，那國是有福的；耶和華揀選作自己產業的，那民是有福的。

words.note: Often used in the structure '以...為...' (take...as...)
Refers to the singular God in this context.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'those who take YHWH as God'
Lit. 'possessing blessing'
Literally 'pick and choose'
Often refers to spiritual inheritance in biblical context.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'those whom YHWH chooses as his inheritance'
Lit. 'possessing blessing'

verses.text: 耶和華從天上觀看，他看見全人類。
從自己的住處，他察看地上所有的居民。

words.note: Here means 'on the earth'

verses.text: 他是那創造眾人的心，了解他們一切作為的。

words.note: Used to introduce a defining clause.
Lit. 'one cut/slice', meaning all aspects.
Links the preceding phrase to the '那' (the one who).

verses.text: 君王不是因兵多得勝，勇士不是因力大得救。

words.note: Common in Christian contexts for spiritual or divine victory.
A core term in Christian theology.

verses.text: 想靠馬得勝是枉然的；馬雖然力大，也不能救人。

words.note: Often used in literary or more formal contexts.

verses.text: 耶和華的眼睛看顧敬畏他的人，和那些仰望他慈愛的人；

words.note: Often refers to divine providence or protection.
A central concept in biblical piety.

words.definition: to look up to, hope in
words.note: Often used for spiritual expectation or trust in God.
A key attribute of God in the Bible.

verses.text: 要搭救他們的性命脫離死亡，使他們在饑荒中可以存活。

words.definition: to escape from, be free from

words.note: Often used for spiritual death or the power of death.
A common trial in biblical narratives.
Often implies divine preservation during hardship.

verses.text: 我們的心等候耶和華，他是我們的幫助、我們的盾牌。

words.note: Often used in scripture for waiting on God.
A common attribute of God in the Psalms.
A metaphor for God's protection.

verses.text: 我們的心因他歡樂，因為我們倚靠他的聖名。

words.note: Implies a strong sense of dependence and trust.

verses.text: 耶和華啊！求你照著我們所仰望你的，向我們施慈愛。

words.note: Transliteration of God's personal name.
Forms a nominalized phrase with the following verb.
Expresses earnest expectation and trust in God.
Completes the nominalized phrase '我們所仰望你的' (that which we hope in you).
A core attribute of God in the Bible.
